title: Trio prepare to reopen well-known Stoke-on-Trent beauty spot cafe
title_page: Trio prepare to reopen well-known Stoke-on-Trent beauty spot cafe - BBC News
maintext:
Three women who are reopening a well-known cafe at a Stoke-on-Trent nature reserve have said they are taking on 10 staff, and hope to employ more.
Westport Lake Cafe had been run by Staffordshire Wildlife Trust for 15 years until the charity moved out in autumn 2024.
Now Joanne Upton, Corinne Mannion and Amy Mansfield - who all work in care - have taken on a 10 year lease for the site with Stoke-on-Trent City Council.
The trio said they wanted the cafe, set to reopen on 22 March, to be a place that brought the whole community together.
They had originally been looking for a venue that could be used as a social club for adults with learning difficulties, and discovered that the building had become available.
"We fell in love with the place, and then the pressure was on to get the business proposal together for the city council," said Ms Mansfield, who described the process of securing the lease as "fun, but stressful."
